item.title: Theory of Operation
item.description: Hamstercage keeps a list of files under management in a manifest file, by default hamstercage.yaml. The various Hamstercage commands can be used to add, update, and remove files from the manifest, but you can always make changes manually, for example to correct the owner or mode of a file. Managed files are kept not as a single list, but as multiple lists, one for each tag. A tag is simply a label for a set of files.

item.title: Installation
item.description: Hamstercage is a Python module. You can install it from the source repository, or from [PyPi(https://pypi.org/project/hamstercage/)]. pip install hamstercage Using Hamstercage After installation, Hamstercage is available on the path as hamstercage. Creating a new Hamstercage repo Hamstercage needs a manifest file in order to track files managed through it. You can create this file manually, or you can have Hamstercage create a template file for you: hamstercage init This creates hamstercage.
